statement.p: A coffee distributor plans to mix some Kona coffee that sells for \displaystyle\${12.40} per pound with some Gualtemala Antigua coffee that sells for \displaystyle\${13.50} per pound to create \displaystyle{60} pounds of a new coffee blend that will sell for \displaystyle\${12.80} per pound.
How many pounds of each kind of coffee should they mix? Round to the nearest pound.
